Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of large Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of large lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: around rim, diagonal stroke band between pairs of brown lines; below at bottom left, trace of undetermined motif, possibly tip of sphinx's wing, to left; spiked rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the rim pattern, see British Museum 1888,0601.464.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0452) (phase 2)
